Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: @jl777c I gave a thought on solving the parallel withdraw problem on friday and over the weekend. I have and idea to create another msig address from the same pubkeys (if possible) and move the funds that are used for withdraw over there. This would solve both parallel withdraw and the balance thing as we would know how much is left. Ofc, the withdraw should expire after sometime and those fund need to be returned to the deposit address so it can be used again and have correct balance. That part is IMHO little bit picky as we have to be sure funds are not stuck at temp address.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: great!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just change the order of the pubkeys in the redeemscript

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you can make N! different msig addresses from N pubkeys

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Aha, so if the order of keys is 1,3,2 it wil give different address than 1,2,3.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the msig address is rmd160(sha256(redeemscript))

I would like to avoid waiting it to be mined and then creating raw tx in another step as it would need another tx and syncing with external chain...

Content: I mix 1of1 and multisig situations when thinking as I was testing a lot with 1of1 gateway...

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: For the sake of knowing exact balance and for parallel withdraw, it would be good to reserve the utxos that will be spent in withdraw. The best way was to spend them to temp address as it would have exact utxo and the rest utxo would be available for spending in other withdraws. But as this also needs multiple signing process, something else must be done in order to solve this.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe think in terms of managing the total balance in convenient sizes. the msig signers can prepare these utxos while collecting the 5% rewards

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: The collecting rewards thing haven't been made yet, and this will also be difficult as multi signing thing must be done. Nevertheless, even if we have convenient sizes we must mark that utxo will be spent in order to both know exact balance at the moment and to avoid using same utxo in two parallel withdraws.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: how about 8 parallel withdraws

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: prepare ahead of time 1/8th of balance in each of 8 subaddresses. for each withdraw, do a userpubkey % 8 to find which of the 8 parallel tracks it will use and single thread within each.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the restriction is that no more than 1/8th of total balance can be withdrawn at once, which seems an acceptable limitation

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: each withdraw track, can then use a baton to ensure only one pending withdraw at a time

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: as a withdraw happens, then a rebalancing of funds in the 7 other addresses would need to happen, maybe just do this once per day, along with collection of rewards

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: something like this. where the withdraws are constrained to allow multiple withdraws that dont conflict at all

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and total balance info can be put into the opreturn and validated that it properly adjusts from the previous balance, this way we dont need an external source for balance info

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Hmmm, I have to think about it little bit. Splitting in 8 different balances is ok, and baton (on AC side I suppose) would resolve reserving utxos for withdraw. The rebalancing thing would require automated "withdraw" of all 8 balances back to new 8 balances and the siging process to be done....

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: In the beginning when there are little deposits, it will be probably difficult to iwthdraw your deposit as it can be more than 1/8 of balance...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: unless, we make specific set of initial deposits to cover the startup case

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: with a daily rebalancing, the msig nodes can just spend all the 8 balances to the 8 addresses in a single rebalancing transaction, i guess skipping any pending withraws

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if an incremental method can be made, it would be better

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe a just in time process where funds are kept in the main msig address and only transferred to the 8 withdraw balance addresses, as needed. it is an extra transaction, but if we can do this, then it handles the case when there are not enough funds in the 1/8th address

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: once that case is handled, if we notice that there are already enough funds in the 1/8th address, then the transfer from main address can be skipped

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i think it is a matter to carefully track the 9 balances, and 8 pending withdraws

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Every transfer is again multi sig tx which needs signing

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and there are the new funds that are coming in, that start as unallocated. maybe they can be moved to the 1/8th address with the lowest balance, so this is the incremental aspect

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, i am assuming that automating a msig tx is achieved already

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: We have automated signing process, but it is slow and it requires txs on AC.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so the various states that a utxo can be in needs to be tracked and then make sure that the opreturn data has the required summaries. it could be that we have an "intialize" process that takes all the existing balances and gets things into a proper state

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: as long as it is automated, slow is ok, just not too slow. 10 blocks for a signature is 10 minutes, which seems ok

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: This all brings complexity of the system to a whole new level and creates space for errors. The utxo system was a perfect thing but with msig it is difficult to use it as it requires complete process for signing

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe we need to do it like iguana notarizer and make it direct p2p to get the msig tx signed

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but regardless of signing method, i think as long as a withdraw progresses toward completion, or times out and can be resubmitted, it will be complex, but will still work

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: That would be great, to reduce the overhead we have for signing and to have instant signing. Then we would be able to move the funds to temp address.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what if you used the mempool?

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: For what?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: why wait for confirmations to complete the signing?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: couldnt the msig signers scan the mempool and see if there is any new tx that needs to be signed?

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Can't remember why I did it this way. I think there was some issue, but maybe it can be done.

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content:
So the flow would be like this:
- withdraw tx created (on AC)
- oraclefeed takes utxos and make utxo to temp address in exact amount
- signing is done immediately in mempool and external tx broadcasted
- then createrawtx can be done right away without waiting for previous external tx to be mined
- signing again starts and it finishes completely in mempool
- now the real withdraw tx is broadcasted on external chain (but waiting for previous tx to be mined)

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: I think there was some problem with race condition for signing, and one by one tx was making it ok.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe separate the rawtx construction and signing

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: But with a baton, there will not be any race condition

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: each node can independently sign the same rawtx and just submit the signature in an opretuen

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then you can combine M of the signatures to make a valid signed transaction

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: I think there will be no problem with that as long as I'm using sequential signing with a baton. If two nodes want to sign and spend baton at the sametime, one will succed and other won't as baton will be spent

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: This temp address thing wil take one more txfee from the external funds so the user will receive amount-2*txfees-non-spending marker fee. For expensive coins I think we can set txfee to minimum and marker fee can be like 1k sat

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: We could also make markers 1 sat, is there anything against this?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it might fall below dust threshold

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: can the marker be on the AC side?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i mean baton

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Baton is on AC side, but the non-spendable marker to mark that the external withdraw has been executed and prevent double withdraws must be on external chain. That is why I'm asking how low we can go with the amount?

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: And baton on the ac side will in the end be spent to the nodes pubkey which does markdone tx on AC

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i think 500 or 600 sats is the dust level for a lot of chains

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Ok so we can go with 1k sat

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: This will be insignificant for BTC

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: a 10 cents per BTC withdraw is not so bad, we just need to have a minimum withdraw so the percentage is reasonable max

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: With 100k BTC price this will be 1$. With 10k it is 0.10$

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it seems acceptable, just have a minimum withdraw big enough so it is never more than 5% fee

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content:
@jl777c So I have totaly refactored the logic of gateways withdraw (for now on importgateway to test) and it seems this will be better. The flow goes like this:
- withdraw tx created by user
- when confirmed/notarized, oraclefeed takes one withdraw at the time and creates raw tx
- signing happens in mempool so it should be fast and while not signed completely no new withdraws are processed
- when it is signed completely it is broadcasted on external chain and markedone
- then new withdraw is taken from the queue and processed
So we have parallel withdraws created, but serial processing of them one by one (probably it can be more than one per block as everything happens in mempool).

And now thee is only the question of checking balance, as I think the n/2 consensus is not good because when the withdraw is broadcasted externally in that moment the balance is lowered and until it reaches n/2 nodes publishing it in the mean time another withdraw could be created. So I suggest we use minimum that is reporeted in latest oraclesdata. Even if some node reports false balance that is lower, it could only get withdraws halted until we resolve it.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this does sound a lot better! serialized, but processed via mempool is a good trick!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that will allow precise calculation of available balances

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Yes, just hope there will not be some problem because everything is in mempool, if some tx does not reach mined block it could block others that depend on it...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in that case it will get mined in the next block. given a chain of mempool tx, it cant be mined out of order!

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Yeah

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Just thinking if something can cause problems

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it might cause tx to expire and invalidate a chain if it isnt mined in time

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: make sure to disable expiration. if you dont use nlocktime and set expireblocks to 0, it wont expire. of course, then you wont collect the rewards... so i think we need to make sure that rewards are actively collected to not lose too much unclaimed rewards. then when needed to do a withdraw, it is only a few hours of lost rewards. that will keep the mempool chain of tx all valid, regardless of how long they take to confirm.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: also, rebroadcasting the unconfirmed rawtx until it confirms will assure that it will eventually confirm

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Are you talking about external txs or on AC?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for any mempool tx chain. rebroadcasting will maximize chance it is mined sooner than later. important thing is to make sure the tx cannot expire via the mempool expiration, or for KMD via nlocktime being too old

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: I have set locktime to 0 for createrawtransaction on all chains, and for Sapling chains I have set expiryheight to 10000 that should be enough for approx. 7 days when blocktime is 1 min. But the withdraw will expire probably in an few hours as now when signing is in mempool it should execute at worst after hour or so (after initial withdraw tx is confirmed for chains without notarziation).

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ok

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: I didn't know that expiryheight 0 is to not expire at all, I can set 0 instead!

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: But I didn't get the reward part you mentioned...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i guess you can claim rewards even with locktime of 0, but the output wont be valid for claiming as it needs locktime

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so we would need to have a daily rewards claiming among the msig nodes to minimize the lost rewards from not claiming

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: during withdraws

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Are you speaking about the rewards for holding KMD?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you remember, to claim rewards in KMD, it needs to be one hour old and be >10KMD and have locktime set

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this is the funds that pays for the msig signers running the nodes long term

Content: Ok, I haven't at all approached the reward thing yet. Aha, ok that is the business logic for msig signers.
